resources.string: The human body naturally burns more calories to maintain one pound of muscle than one pound of fat. Therefore, the more muscle you build, the higher is your resting energy spending, and the more calories your body will burn at rest.

The faster your metabolism, the more calories you burn. While metabolism is heavily influenced by genetics, certain changes, such as weightlifting and resistance training, can boost your metabolism and promote fat loss.

Did you know digestion burns calories? And protein burns the most calories. Good protein sources include lean meats like chicken and fish, as well as dairy, whole grains, beans, lentils, and nuts. Include protein portions with every meal.
High Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) can help you burn more fat and calories by increasing your metabolism, even after your workout is over. Incorporate HIIT into your workout routine.
Lack of sleep can decrease the number of calories you burn, and is linked to a major increase in the risk of obesity. Try to have 8 hours of sleep every night.
Small Food Tips That Go a Long Way
Fat-free foods are usually high in sugar and contain “empty calories”. Instead, opt for fruits, vegetables, quality protein, and other whole foods.

Removing sodas, fast foods, candy, and highly processed confectioneries is a good way to improve health. However, you don\'t have to completely remove such snacks. These foods can be eaten in addition and moderation to your healthy diet, but should not be the primary source of your caloric intake.

When hungry, your aim should be to eat nutritious and filling foods, not to eat as little calories as possible. Choose protein and fiber-rich foods, as these foods fill you up and nourish your body. Protein also assists in muscle development and maintenance.

Often, we mistake dehydration for hunger. Staying hydrated is an important part of eating healthy. Water is the best way to hydrate yourself. Buy a reusable bottle and carry it around to remember to hydrate.

Start small. A big change can be overwhelming and discouraging. Instead, if you eat takeout food frequently, try cooking one meal at home. Aim for eating fruits instead of sugary drinks. Create a list of simple healthy alternatives to assist.

A balanced diet provides nutrients your body needs to work effectively. Without proper nutrition, your body is more prone to fatigue, disease, infection, and overall low performance. A balanced diet will combine various foods from fruits, vegetables, whole grain, protein and dairy.
7. One Diet Does Not Fit All

Everyone is unique, and our differences in genetics, body types and lifestyle determine which diet is fit and sustainable. Experiment with different healthy meal plans to determine which you find enjoyable and can keep up with in the long run.
Too much cardio can actually prevent fat loss because your body will start burning muscle for fuel. Instead, opt for resistance training, which builds muscle, to increase your metabolic rate.

When you get less sleep, your system produces more cortisol, a hormone that can cause weight gain when it’s out of normal range. Aim for at least 8 hours of sleep every day. Sleeping also aids in recovery, and assists in building more lean muscle which will help you burn more calories at rest.
These foods help you feel full, thus may also help with weight loss. Protein also assists in muscle development and maintenance.
4. Get Faster Results With Shorter Workouts

High-intensity interval training (HIIT) has more cardiovascular and fat-loss benefits than any other workout. It involves short bursts of maximum effort followed by a small resting period for some number of rounds. HIIT workouts can range from 5 minutes to 15. Incorporate HIIT into your workout routine.
Performing multiple variations of an exercise can increase muscles engaged and the amount of weight you can lift, leading to greater gains and results than repeating same exercises month after month.
Why You Should Start Working Out Today
Exercise can improve your mood and decrease feelings of depression, anxiety, and stress. It also benefits your mood regardless of the intensity of your workout.

Regular exercise increases your metabolic rate, which can burn more calories and help you lose weight. Additionally, combining cardio with resistance training can maximize fat loss and muscle mass maintenance, which is essential for keeping the weight off and maintaining lean muscle mass.
Regular exercise, combined with a healthy diet, can help prevent and manage Type 2 Diabetes, heart disease, many types of cancer, high cholesterol and hypertension.

Exercise increases your heart rate, which promotes blood flow and oxygen to your brain. It can also assist the growth of brain cells, increase cognitive performance, and prevent conditions like Alzheimer’s disease and dementia.
Regular physical activity, regardless of whether it is cardio or a combination of cardio and resistance training, can help you sleep better and feel more energized during the day.
Things That Stop You From Seeing Results

Too much cardio can prevent fat loss since your body will burn muscles for fuel. A better alternative is to incorporate strength training, which builds muscle mass and increases metabolism, alongside HIIT, which tones the body, for better results.

If you do the same exercise frequently, your body adapts and the workout is not effective anymore. Whereas with varied functional movements, your body will need to work harder to keep up. Vary your routine by changing intensity, weights, duration or working on entirely new muscle groups or trying new activities.
Warm-ups activate and prepare your muscles for workouts by getting your heart pumping more blood into them, which improves your workout performance.

Depending on your level of fitness and intensity of your workout, the time required to recover will vary. A good routine would be three days of training, four days of rest for beginners and up to five days of training for people with higher levels of fitness.

Because our bodies are unique, there is no all-inclusive nutrition advice. However, a great start is to eat “mindfully” and to opt for nutrient-dense unprocessed whole foods, high-quality proteins and essential fats, whenever possible.

This is the guide to use the Milestones and Rewards page for Fit Garage. First, the user needs to log in and start exercising following one of the workout types on the workouts page. Once the user has selected the workout level for the specific workout, a timer will display along with the exercise routine. The Milestones progress bar will increase every minute the user performs the workout for and will stop progressing when the user has done 30 minutes worth of exercise. When the user completes a milestone, the app will then reward the user with the in-app currency called FitTokens. Once the user has collected enough FitTokens, they will be able to redeem vouchers for sports apparel, shoes, equipments and accessories in the Store page.
If you have any further queries, do not hesitate to contact us at hfymz2@nottingham.edu.my.

When you sign up for Fit Garage, you give us certain information voluntarily which include your email address when you first register, the duration in which you workout for whenever you start the timer and last but not least, the amount of calories you burn when you do your workouts.

First and foremost, we would like to thank our supervisor, Dr.Tan, for without him our group would not be able to create Fit Garage. His assistance includes helping us have a clear view of what we’re doing, as well as providing useful feedback and constructive criticism which helped us make a better product.

Furthermore, we would like to thank Pexels, Flabfix, Gfycat, Makeagif, PrecisionNutrition, and Giphy for providing us with the open-source workout videos. These are high-quality videos and they teach new users how to do specific exercises with good form to avoid injuries. Without these open-source websites, we would not be able to make an app that is suitable for beginners as some of the exercises we encourage our users to perform requires a good form.

Moreover, we’d like to express our gratitude towards the fitness youtubers that informed us of the best routines for each level of workout. Fitness youtubers such as Pamela Reif, Women’s Health UK, and ThenX helped create a similar routine for our Glutes & Legs workout. Youtubers Jordan Yeoh Fitness, BullyJuice, and NEXT workout inspired us for the Shoulders & Arm workout routines. Keep Trainer inspired our Back & Chest workout routine while Naomi Kong, Daniela Suarez, and Heather Robertson inspired our Abs & Core workout routines.
Lastly, we\'d like to thank Healthline for providing the tips for Fit Garage’s Tips page where some small tips that will help beginners in the long run are given.
